title.value: PCR-diagnostics for detection of latent carriers of a disease of complex vertebral malformation of cattle
ПЦР-диагностика комплексного порока позвоночника у крупного рогатого скота

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Baranova, L.A., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering
Volotovskij, I.D., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering

abstract.value: One of the most important challenges of animal husbandry appears the problem of receiving of healthy and viable offspring. The number of spontaneous abortions of cows requires determination of the etiology of the occurrence. One of the most wide spread reason of misbirth appears complex vertebral malformation (CVM) of cattle. Differential characteristics of CVM-calves are general underdevelopment, deformation of spinal bones, short-cut neck, scoliosis and deformation of diarthroses. The technique of DNA analysis allowing reliable identification of carriers and latent carriers of the CVM disease of cattle is worked out and presented in the article. The optimal conditions of testing the complex vertebral malformation alleles with PIRA-PCR method are determined. Practical use of the PCR-testing of complex vertebral malformation of cattle, involving excluding CVM-carrier animals out of reproduction cycle and allowing declining of the level of calves' deaths, is substantiated. Further control of hereditary diseases with the help of PCR-method is proved.
